pages.text: The bucket of water is not consumed in making these bricks. When placed in the world, they will become difficult terrain, slowing anyone who walks upon them. $(info) All dry variants listed here are available through the stonecutter.

pages.title: Drying Into Blocks
pages.text: In addition to a regular furnace, wet mud can be cooked at a much faster rate in a Kiln. Once dried, they can be used as-is or crafted into additional $(l:decorations/mud_bricks)brick variants$().

pages.title: Drying Into Blocks
pages.text: Once dried, they can be used as-is or crafted into additional $(l:decorations/mud_bricks)brick variants$().

pages.title: Stairs & Slabs
pages.text: Mud blocks, in their dried form, can be crafted into stairs and slabs using the usual pattern.

pages.title: Fences & Gates
pages.text: Mud blocks can be crafted into fences in the same way as nether bricks, replacing nether bricks with sticks.

pages.title: Posts
pages.text: These posts are similar to individual fence and wall blocks but will not connect.

pages.title: Walls
pages.text: Walls are crafted in the normal fashion.
